recipes.name: Chicken and Rice Casserole
recipes.author: Merrily Seely
ingredients: 2 cans of cream of chicken soup
recipes.procedure: Place rice in large pot.  Add 4 c. water & 1 tsp. salt.  Bring to a boil.  Reduce heat to low.  Cook for 20 minutes.  Sauté onion in butter.  Cube chicken or turkey.  Mix all ingredients together, adding milk last as needed to moisten.  Place in a greased 9” X 13” casserole dish.  Top with: 8 c. crushed Rice Chex cereal  and ½ c. melted butter. Bake at 350° F for 1 hour uncovered.

recipes.name: Chicken Divan
recipes.author: Ruth Johnson
ingredients: 2 10½ oz cans cream of chicken soup
¾ c mayonnaise or salad dressing
recipes.procedure: Cook broccoli until tender, drain.  Arrange in greased 12x7½x2-inch glass baking dish.  Layer chicken atop.  Combine next 3 ingredients and pour over chicken.  Sprinkle with cheese.  Combine crumbs and butter.  Sprinkle over all.  Bake at 350° F about 35 minutes or until heated through.

recipes.name: Chicken Enchiladas
recipes.author: Merrily Seely
ingredients: mozzarella cheese (as much as is desired)
recipes.procedure: Cook and shred 2 c chicken.  Mix 1 can cream of cream of chicken soup and 1 c sour cream.  Coat 6 flour tortillas with soup mixture.  Divide chicken between flour tortillas, adding mozzarella cheese.  Roll and place in 9”x13” pan.  Drizzle remaining sauce over top.  Top with mozzarella cheese.  Cook 30 minutes at 350° F.

recipes.name: Lemon Chicken
recipes.author: Merrily Seely
recipes.procedure:
4 skinless breasts or 8 thighs or any equivalent amount of chicken.  Place chicken in crock pot.  Cover with sauce:
½ c sugar	 ¼ c brown sugar
¾ c lemon juice	 ⅜ c catsup
2 TBSP vinegar
Cover & cook in crock pot 3-4 hours on high or 6-8 hours on low heat.  Blend:
¼ c cold water	¼ c  cornstarch
Mix with cooked liquid in saucepan until thick and bubbly.  Serve with chicken over rice.

recipes.name: Lemon Chicken Skillet Dinner
recipes.author: Our Best Bites
ingredients: ½ tsp ground black pepper, divided
recipes.procedure:
Preheat oven to 450° F.  Place potatoes in a medium saucepan; cover with water. Bring to a boil, and simmer 12 minutes or until tender. Drain.  Line a baking sheet with foil and set aside.  Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add 1 tsp oil to pan. Sprinkle chicken lightly with salt and pepper. Add chicken to pan; cook 5 minutes or until chicken is browned. Turn chicken over and cook for 1 minute.  Transfer chicken to foil-lined pan and place in oven for 10 minutes or until chicken is done.  While chicken is cooking, add remaining 2 tsp oil to skillet. Add potatoes, cut sides down to one side of the skillet, and the mushrooms and garlic to the other. Cook for 3-5 minutes or until browned, stirring mushrooms and garlic.  Remove vegetables from pan and set on a plate to the side.
	Combine milk and flour in a small bowl, stirring with a whisk.  Add flour mixture and 3/4 cup of the chicken broth along with a sprinkle of salt and pepper to the skillet and whisk until smooth.  Bring sauce to a simmer, and add beans.  Simmer 2-3 minutes or until sauce starts to thicken. Add lemon slices, potatoes and mushrooms, and chicken.  If sauce is too thick, add small amounts of chicken broth to thin.  Reduce heat and simmer 3-4 minutes or until beans are crisp-tender. Season with additional salt and pepper to taste.

recipes.name: Homemade Wheat Bread
recipes.author: Rachael Howell
recipes.procedure: Combine oil, honey, salt, water and yeast (in that order) to a stand mixer.  Add 2 c flour and mix on speed 1.  Add remaining flour 1 c at a time ‘til the dough pulls away from sides and leaves sides clean.  It might get sticky again, but you’d rather have it too sticky than too dry.  Let it knead 10 more minutes.  Remove dough hook, cover with a towel.  Let rise ‘til double, about an hour.  Punch down.  Cover it again, let it rise again till double, probably a little shorter this time.  Punch down.  Divide into 2 parts, roll each one into a rectangle (about 8 x 4 inches) and roll up.  Pinch and fold ends, to fit into 2 greased loaf pans.  Let rise ‘til double.  Bake at 340° F for 25-30 minutes.

recipes.name: Breadmaker Honey Wheat Bread
recipes.author: Merrily Seely
recipes.procedure: Add all ingredients to bread maker in order listed.  Set bread maker to “wheat” setting.  Makes a 2 lbs. loaf.

recipes.name: Pizza Dough
recipes.author: Rachael Howell
recipes.procedure: Knead for 5-10 minutes, till smooth elastic ball, (can do in a bread maker). Let rise about 45 minutes. Deflate gently and allow to rest for 15 minutes. Roll into pizza crust as desired. You can refrigerate dough in an oiled plastic bag for up to two days. It also makes yummy breadsticks, (cut with a pizza cutter, twisted and rolled in butter, sprinkled with garlic powder and parmesan and placed on a cookie sheet). Bake about 415° F for 12-15 minutes.

recipes.name: French Bread
recipes.author: Rachael Howell
recipes.procedure: Combine yeast and water; let bubble 5-10 minutes.  Add salt, butter and 4 c flour; mix well.  Add remaining 3 c flour about a c. at a time until all is combined.  Knead 5-10 minutes, until dough is smooth elastic ball.  Let rise one hour, ‘til doubled.  Punch down and divide dough into two balls.  Roll each out into rectangle, flip over and roll up into loaf shape.  Pinch closed and tuck ends underneath, plump and shape loaf.  Let rise 45 minutes and bake at 450° F for about 25 minutes.  After 20 minutes, brush loaves with the egg white and water mixture.  Finish baking for the last 5 minutes and remove from oven.

recipes.name: Cinnamon Rolls
recipes.author: Rachael Howell
recipes.procedure: Combine yeast with warm water and 1 TBSP sugar.  Let bubble.  Add milk, sugar, salt, eggs and flour.  Mix well.  Knead 1-2 minutes.  Let rise ‘til double.  Roll into rectangle (thin as a graham cracker) and spread with ⅓ c gutter.  Combine brown sugar, cinnamon and ⅛ c butter and sprinkle on dough.  Roll up dough and slice into 12 rolls.  Bake at 350° F for 15-20 minutes.  Combine frosting ingredients and frost warm rolls.

recipes.name: Buttermilk Apple Muffins
recipes.author: Rachael Howell
recipes.procedure: Heat oven to 325° F.  Blend brown sugar, oil, egg and vanilla in large bowl. Combine dry ingredients and add to wet mixture. Add apples and buttermilk and mix just to moisten. Fill paper lined or greased muffin tins ⅔ full. Combine topping ingredients and sprinkle over muffins. Bake at 325° F for 15-20 minutes. Makes 12 muffins. (After 20 minutes, I upped the temp to 350° F and baked another 2-3 minutes. This just wasn't enough.)

recipes.name: Apple (or Peach) Crisp
recipes.author: Better Homes and Gardens
recipes.procedure: Combine oats, brown sugar, flour, cinnamon, and dash salt.  Cut in butter till mixture resembles coarse crumbs; set aside.  Peel, core, and slice fruit to make 5 to 6 c.  Place fruit in a 10x6x2-inch baking dish.  Sprinkle with granulated sugar.  Sprinkle crumb mixture over all.  Bake in a 350° F oven for 40 to 45 minutes.  Serve with ice cream.  Serves 6.

recipes.name: Apple Pinwheels
recipes.author: Judy Hamilton
recipes.procedure: Mix together sugar, butter, nutmeg, cinnamon, and water.  Boil for 3-5 minutes.  Mix together the flour, baking powder, and salt.  Cut in the shortening, then add the milk. Turn out the dough on a board, knead lightly two or three times, and roll it out to about ¼” thickness.  Peel, core, and grate the apples, season them with a little cinnamon, sugar, and butter.  Spread apples over dough and roll up as for cinnamon rolls.  Slice and place in 9”x13” pan.  Pour hot syrup over and bake at 350° F for about 35-40 minutes.  Serve with sipped cream or ice cream.

recipes.name: Blanc Monge
recipes.author: Merrily Seely
recipes.procedure: Heat hot milk.  Mix dry ingredients in cold milk.  Stir slowly into hot milk until thickened.  Cook 7 minutes, covered.  Cool 10 minutes, covered.  Stir in vanilla.

recipes.name: Chocolate Layered Dessert
recipes.author: Merrily Seely
ingredients: 6 oz pkg inst choc pudding (or rasp sauce)
recipes.procedure: Mix flour, pecans, butter.  Bake in 9”X13” pan at 425° F for 13-15 minutes.  Set aside to cool.  Whip 1 c cream.  Beat cream cheese, add powdered sugar.  Add whipped cream.  Spread over cooled crust.  Make pudding according to directions, maybe cut back on milk a little.  Spread over cream cheese layer.  Whip remaining 1 c cream.  Spread over pudding layer.  Refrigerate.

recipes.name: Churros
recipes.author: Recipe adapted from Anne Burrell
ingredients: Peanut oil or oil with a high smoke point
recipes.procedure:
In a medium saucepan, combine the butter and milk and cook over medium heat until the butter melts. Whisk in the flour and stir until the mixture pulls away from the sides into a glossy ball. Remove from heat. Add 1 egg to the mixture and stir with a wooden spoon until completely combined, then repeat with each egg, not moving onto the next egg until the previous egg is completely mixed. It may be on the thin side, more like a batter, but just let the dough just hang out for about 15-20 minutes (and even if it stays thin, it will work just fine.) You can also do this step using a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment.  Pour about 3″ of oil into a large skillet, pot, or Dutch Oven. Heat the oil over medium heat to 325 degrees F (use a candy or instant read thermometer to keep the temperature in check.)  Preheat oven to the lowest setting.
	While the oil is heating, whisk together the sugar, cinnamon, and salt (if desired) in a pie plate.  When the oil is almost ready, transfer the dough to a pastry bag fitted with a large star tip (like open 1M or larger). Squeeze about 3″ of dough into the hot oil and repeat, not crowding the pan (you’ll have to fry the churros in a few batches). Cook for about 3-4 minutes on one side or until golden brown, then flip and continue cooking another 2-3 minutes on the other side (or until the other side is also golden brown.) Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate and place the plate in the oven. Repeat frying until the dough is gone.  When all the churros have been cooked, toss them in the cinnamon-sugar mix and serve immediately. Makes about 24 3″ churros. If desired, serve with dark chocolate ganache for dipping.

recipes.name: Beef and Black Bean Chili
recipes.author: Merrily Seely
ingredients: roast beef, cooked in crock pot until falls apart
recipes.procedure: Put it all in a crock pot and cook for 4-6 hours.

recipes.name: Chicken Noodle Soup
recipes.author: Merrily Seely, from Consumer Reports
recipes.procedure: Brown chicken in butter.  Add onions & cook until translucent.  Add all other ingredients except noodles.  Bring to boil, then simmer for 30 minutes.  Remove chicken.  Discard bones and skin.  Dice chicken & return to pan.  Return to boil.  Add noodles.  Cook for 7-9 minutes.

recipes.name: Clam Chowder
recipes.author: Merrily Seely, based on recipe from Blanche Heidt
recipes.procedure: Peel and cube potatoes.  Chop celery.  Place potatoes and celery in bowl.  Drain juice from clams over potatoes and celery.  Liquid should cover vegetables—add additional water, if needed.  Melt butter in large pot.  Add onions & sauté until translucent.  Mix in flour.  Add milk, vegetables, and seasoning.  Stir, then simmer until potatoes are tender.  Add clams.  Serves 8.

recipes.name: Crab Chowder
recipes.author: Merrily Seely
recipes.procedure: Peel and cube potatoes.  Chop celery and dice pepper.  Place vegetables in bowl.   Add water until it just covers vegetables.  Melt butter in large pot.  Add onions & sauté until translucent.  Mix in flour.  Add milk, vegetables, and seasoning.  Stir, then simmer until potatoes are tender.  Add crab.  Serves 8.

recipes.name: Caesar Salad
recipes.author: Sally Duffy
recipes.procedure: Mix all dressing ingredients and whisk until well blended.
